ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Junior Seminar is an amazing class to see what artists at Yale are up to, and also to find out who they are. I've learned more about the world of art and different art styles and what it means to be an artist.
learned about different artists, different perspectives on art, and how to look at my own art critically

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Pros: The visiting artists class was the only one I felt really engaged in. It was really nice to hear about the grad students' work.

Cons: This course was taught in a very "artist" way...the subject of each week was always subject to change and there was no syllabus or structure. Moreover, the class would often run 20 minutes over because the professor didn't keep track of time...this would have been more tolerable if the class didn't end at 8:50 PM. Additionally, when we were doing artist presentations, some people were cut short at 5 minutes while others got 30+ minutes to themselves...people who liked to talk and were more confident were getting a disproportionate level of attention. Basic scheduling of presentation slots could have fixed this.
The energy of the class was very subject to the mood of the professor, and more often than not I did not enjoy being there.

This course mainly consisted of discussions based on readings or just different topics people are interested in, so it was very freeform and nice. I can see this causing stress for people who like to have more concrete deadlines and tasks but personally I enjoyed it. The artist statement was a bit tricky for me because as a Computing and the Arts major I don't quite consider myself an artist sometimes.
strength, it is a low work load course and it gets you to think in a new way about art. weakness it is difficult to keep up if you don't have background in art theory

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you are an art major, you have to take this...
Yes! This is a great choice to fulfill the junior art requirement.
yes it is helpful if you are in art major
